p: This approach proves apt for investigating small viral genomes that can be covered with only a few PCR amplicons. However, vast heterogeneity of RNA viruses (e.g., HCV27, Noroviruses and Rhabdoviruses) might require the use of multiple primer sets to ensure amplification of all known genotypes [ 130, 136]. Some researchers propose that this method, coupled with NGS, is used for large viral genomes, like HCMV [ 19]. In this case, PCR allows long sequences to be “split” into shorter overlapping fragments that can be assembled into a full sequence during data analysis, which increases sequencing depth.
